chunks.text:
We have reviewed the documents and noted that the Assured submitted a claim to reinstate the damaged property at SR.123,438.13. This amount was based on quotations from M/s Boulevard Company Ltd (SR.20,700) and Blue Print (SR.102,738.13). 

 

We reviewed the scope of the work mentioned in the quotes and noted that the claim for SR.20,700 related to the cleaning cost of items that are also replaced under the quote from Blue Print at SR.102,738.13. Therefore, we have adjusted the  SR.20,700 claim to SR.10,000 after removing a portion relating to cleaning items that are also replaced by BlueBird. 

 

The SR.102,738.13 comprises SR.10,062.50 for troubleshooting and repairing the fire alarm system and SR.92,675.63 for repairing/replacing damaged fittings and fixtures. While the repair cost of the fire alarm is indemnifiable, the troubleshooting and inspection of the fire alarm is not, as the Assured must verify the extent of damage. Therefore, we have allowed SR.6,750, net of the troubleshooting estimated at SR.2,000, and SR.1,312.50 for the VAT. The other major items relate to the repair/replacement of damaged fittings and fixtures in the sum of SR.92,675.63. However, the VAT SR.12,088.13 is deducted.

Item

Adjustment (SR)

Remarks

Inspection and repair of fire alarm
